p: Gutierrez et al. (2019) [ 43] studied the activity of the OE of Phania matricarioides (Spreng.) Griseb. against T. cruzi trypomastigotes. The main compounds identified in the EO were lavandulyl acetate and thymyl isobutyrate. The OE was bioactive against T. cruzi (IC 50 = 2.2 Âµg/mL and SI = 13). Table 1 shows essential oils with trypanocidal activity against T. cruzi.
